Instructions: Using the provided web search results, write a comprehensive reply to the given query. Make sure to cite results using [[number](URL)] notation after the reference. If the provided search results refer to multiple subjects with the same name, write separate answers for each subject.
Query: what is the cost of beemax battery for toyota prius
Reply in undefined

Based on the provided web search results, the cost of a BeeMax™ performance battery for a Gen 3 Toyota Prius ranges from $2,249 to $2,500 depending on the specific version and whether a trade-in of the old battery is required [[1](https://www.torquenews.com/8113/if-you-need-new-hybrid-battery-your-toyota-prius-check-place-out)]. However, other options are available, including refurbished and used batteries, which can cost between $1,500 and $1,500 plus labor [[2](https://mechanicbase.com/electric-vehicles/toyota-prius-battery-replacement-cost/)]. Auto parts retailers like AutoZone also sell replacement batteries for Toyota Prius, including an Optima AGM Yellow Top Battery for $179.99 with a 3-year warranty [[3](https://www.autozone.com/batteries-starting-and-charging/battery/toyota/prius)]. It is worth noting that the BeeMax line of batteries comes with a 1-year or 3-year warranty depending on the version purchased [[4](https://www.torquenews.com/8113/3-best-toyota-prius-hybrid-battery-replacement-options)]. Additionally, the cost of battery replacement for Toyota Prius can vary depending on labor and parts needed, but the average cost falls between $2,000 and $2,600 according to Toyota [[6](https://www.thedrive.com/cars-101/38127/prius-battery-life)]. Lastly, it is worth noting that Toyota offers an official warranty for Prius models made before the year 2020, covering 8 years or 100,000 miles, whichever happens first [[7](https://www.slashgear.com/847289/replacing-the-battery-pack-on-a-toyota-prius-costs-more-than-you-think/)].
